stories.title: Star System with Right-Angled Planets Surprises Astronomers
First continents emerged from the ocean 700m years earlier than thought

stories.text:
I have found it hard to really kick off my career in Web3.

I'm a dev with some free-time experience from Web3. I have studied the basic concepts myself and built some small dApps for fun, but I have never properly worked in the field.

My plan has been to first test Web3 as a freelance contributor in DAOs before looking for a permanent career shift. However, I have struggled to find my place in these orgs. You participate in discussions, vote in proposals, and still might miss a project if you're not online at the right time (happens often to me since I'm from Europe...).

Certainly another opportunity would be to look directly for full-time crypto opportunities. Yet, I would feel much more comfortable to start out with freelancing – most projects seem to (understandably) prefer devs with some more experience, and I'd like to be sure I'm capable of delivering value from the get-go.

In my opinion, there has been two main problems in getting started with DAOs:

- Finding organizations: Where do you find these orgs today? Should I just somehow find my way to the correct Discord servers, or what's the process? Certainly everyone knows the biggest few, but I'd like to ensure I stay on track of the latest project launches and the most exciting new opportunities. - Finding work: While "traditional" organizations often promote their opportunities in some job sites or on platforms like LinkedIn, I haven't found any similar sources for DAO projects. Again, being in Discords seems to be the best option – but it just feels so inefficient!

To solve this, my co-founder and I founded Kleoverse (https://www.kleoverse.com/). We gather together all DAOs and open Web3 working opportunities, so that it's frictionless for you as a developer to find the most suitable projects and organizations to start working with. Kleoverse is the single source for all open Web3 projects – just log in and start contributing to those that look exciting!

Soon, we'll help you to build your Web3-native professional identity so that you can verifiably prove your talent. Makes it even easier to find work in Web3 and DAOs :)

If you find this interesting, ensure your early access by signing up today
